Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Annihilation \An*ni`hi*la"tion\, n. [Cf. F. annihilation.] 1. The act of reducing to nothing, or nonexistence; or the act of destroying the form or combination of parts under which a thing exists, so that the name can no longer be applied to it; as, the annihilation of a corporation. [1913 Webster]
2. The state of being annihilated. --Hooker. [1913 Webster]
annihilation n 1: destruction by annihilating something [syn: {obliteration}] 2: total destruction; "bomb tests resulted in the annihilation of the atoll" [syn: {disintegration}]
